question:
Identify a plant on the basis of the following information:
  1. This poisonous plant is found in almost all parts of India and flourishes in winter
  2. Its seeds look very much similar to the mustard seeds but they render inedible oil
  3. It is a very good indicator of recently disturbed or flooded soil
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Argemone mexicana (Kutila, Mexican poppy, Phirangi Datura, Pila-Dhatura, prickly poppy, Satyanasi, Sial Kanta, Ujar kanta) grows wild all over India in the cold season. It is an annual herb, belonging to the family Papaveraceae. All parts of plant are poisonous. The extract of the whole plant (latex) contains two alkaloids Berberine and Protopine. Its seeds resemble mustard and yield 22-36% of pale yellow, nauseous, bitter, non-edible oil [Katkar oil or Argemone oil].
